security_audit.summary: Static scanner flagged patterns from documentation examples including connection strings and shell commands. All findings are false positives - the skill contains template code for FastAPI development with no malicious intent or actual credential exposure.

high_findings.title: Weak cryptographic algorithm references
high_findings.description: Scanner flagged keywords related to password hashing and JWT authentication. These are standard secure patterns (bcrypt/scrypt) used in the template's authentication module. No weak algorithms detected.

high_findings.title: Database connection string patterns
high_findings.description: Example connection strings with placeholder values (user:pass@localhost) appear in configuration documentation. These are legitimate template examples, not actual credentials.

medium_findings.title: Shell command documentation
medium_findings.description: The skill documents shell commands for uv package manager and development setup. These are standard documentation patterns for build tools, not dynamic code execution.

low_findings.title: Environment configuration documentation
low_findings.description: Documentation references .env files and python-dotenv for configuration. Standard practice for Python applications, not a security vulnerability.

low_findings.title: Hardcoded URL in install script
low_findings.description: The uv installer URL (astral.sh) is a legitimate, official source for the package manager.

content.value_statement: Building Python APIs requires modern patterns for async handling, database integration, and project organization. This skill provides production-ready FastAPI templates using uv package manager, SQLAlchemy ORM, and feature-based architecture for scalable API development.
actual_capabilities: Generate modular FastAPI project structure with feature-based architecture
Create SQLAlchemy 2.0 async models with Pydantic v2 schemas
Set up uv package manager for fast Python dependency management
Implement authentication patterns with JWT and password hashing
Configure async database sessions with PostgreSQL and SQLite for testing
Generate Alembic migration files for database schema changes
limitations: Does not generate frontend code or web UI components
Does not provision cloud infrastructure or container configurations
Does not include authentication provider integration beyond basic JWT
Does not generate GraphQL APIs or WebSocket handlers

best_practices: Use feature-based modular architecture to organize code by domain rather than technical layer
Implement async/await throughout the application using SQLAlchemy async sessions and asyncpg
Separate concerns: routes handle HTTP, services contain business logic, repositories handle data access
Use Pydantic v2 for all request/response validation with ConfigDict for ORM integration
anti_patterns: Avoid mixing business logic in route handlers - delegate to service layer
Do not use synchronous database calls in async FastAPI endpoints
Avoid tight coupling between features - use dependency injection for cross-cutting concerns
Do not hardcode secrets or connection strings in source files - use environment variables

faq.question: What is the uv package manager and why use it?
faq.answer: uv is a fast, Rust-based Python package manager that replaces pip and pipenv. It offers significantly faster dependency installation and better caching. This skill uses uv for all Python tooling.

faq.question: How does the feature-based architecture work?
faq.answer: Instead of organizing files by type (all models together, all routes together), feature-based architecture groups all code for a feature in one directory. Each feature has its own api, schemas, services, models, and utils.

faq.question: What database support is included?
faq.answer: The template supports PostgreSQL with asyncpg for production and SQLite with aiosqlite for testing. SQLAlchemy 2.0 async patterns are used throughout for non-blocking database operations.

faq.question: How is authentication implemented?
faq.answer: Basic JWT authentication is demonstrated with password hashing using bcrypt. The skill includes utilities for token creation, password hashing, and protected route dependencies using FastAPI Depends.

faq.question: Can I use this for GraphQL APIs?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on REST APIs. For GraphQL, you would need to add Strawberry or Ariadne separately. The SQLAlchemy models and Pydantic schemas can be reused with a GraphQL framework.

faq.question: How do I run tests?
faq.answer: Tests use pytest with httpx AsyncClient for testing async endpoints. The conftest.py includes fixtures for in-memory SQLite database and async session management. Run tests with 'uv run pytest -v'.
